Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Class TaskGraphExecutorProperties.Builder

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.taskgraph.TaskGraphExecutorProperties.Builder
Enclosing class:
TaskGraphExecutorProperties
public static class TaskGraphExecutorProperties.Builder extends Object
The Builder used to create TaskGraphExecutorProperties instances.

Thread safety

The methods of this class may not be used from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Builder()
    Initializes the Builder with the default values: stopOnFailure: false deliverResultOnFailure: false computeErrorHandler: A callback logging the error on SEVERE level. resultNodeKeys: an empty set
    Builder(TaskGraphExecutorProperties defaults)
    Initializes the Builder with the values of the given TaskGraphExecutorProperties.

  • Constructor Details

    • Builder

      public Builder()
      Initializes the Builder with the default values:
      • stopOnFailure: false
      • deliverResultOnFailure: false
      • computeErrorHandler: A callback logging the error on SEVERE level.
      • resultNodeKeys: an empty set

    • Builder

      public Builder(TaskGraphExecutorProperties defaults)
      Initializes the Builder with the values of the given TaskGraphExecutorProperties. Immediately creating a TaskGraphExecutorProperties from this Builder will yield an effectively equivalent TaskGraphExecutorProperties as the argument.
      Parameters:
      defaults - the default values used to initialize the Builder. This argument cannot be null.

  • Method Details

    • addResultNodeKey

      public final void addResultNodeKey(TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey)
      Declares that the result of the node identified by the given TaskNodeKey is to be delivered to the TaskGraphExecutionResult. Calling this method with the same key multiple times has the same effect as calling it only once.
      Parameters:
      nodeKey - the id of the node whose result is to be delivered to the TaskGraphExecutionResult. This argument cannot be null.

    • addResultNodeKeys

      public final void addResultNodeKeys(Collection<? extends TaskNodeKey<?,?>> nodeKeys)
      Declares that the result of the nodes identified by the given TaskNodeKeys are to be delivered to the TaskGraphExecutionResult. Calling this method with the same key multiple times has the same effect as calling it only once.
      Parameters:
      nodeKeys - the ids of the nodes whose result is to be delivered to the TaskGraphExecutionResult. This argument cannot be null.

    • setDeliverResultOnFailure

      public final void setDeliverResultOnFailure(boolean deliverResultOnFailure)
      Sets the flag determining if the result of the computation should be delivered to the TaskGraphExecutionResult or not. That is, if this flag is set, the task graph execution never completes exceptionally, instead it will always deliver a TaskGraphExecutionResult (even if canceled). So, if this flag is set, partial results can be retrieved.
      Parameters:
      deliverResultOnFailure - true if results on failure must be delivered, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • setStopOnFailure(boolean)

    • setStopOnFailure

      public final void setStopOnFailure(boolean stopOnFailure)
      Sets the flag determining if execution should be canceled after encountering the first failure, or not.
      Parameters:
      stopOnFailure - true if execution should be canceled after encountering the first failure, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • setDeliverResultOnFailure(boolean)

    • setComputeErrorHandler

      public final void setComputeErrorHandler(TaskErrorHandler computeErrorHandler)
      Sets the callback notified whenever a failure occurs while trying to execute the action of a node. Setting the callback will override any previously set value.
      Parameters:
      computeErrorHandler - the callback notified whenever a failure occurs while trying to execute the action of a node. This argument cannot be null.

    • build

      public TaskGraphExecutorProperties build()
      Creates a snapshot of the current state of this Builder. Further adjustment of this Builder will not affect the returned TaskGraphExecutorProperties.
      Returns:
      a snapshot of the current state of this Builder. This method may never return null.
